output module¶

class output.SolutionReader(file)¶

Bases: object

reads solution csv file and stores the information in arrays

Parameters

file (str) – file to read

calculate_mass(t=0.0)¶

calculates TPS mass at specified time

Parameters

t (float) – time (Default value = 0.0)

Returns

TPS mass

Return type

float

get_max_T()¶

returns maximum global temperature over time

Returns

maximum global temperature

Return type

float

get_max_back_T()¶

returns maximum back face temperature over time

Returns

maximum back face temperature

Return type

float

get_remaining_thickness()¶

calculates remaining thickness of TPS at end of calculation

Returns

returns remaining thickness of TPS

Return type

float

plot(x_axis, y_axis, t=None, z=None, x=None)¶
Parameters

  • x_axis (str) – variable to plot on x axis

  • y_axis (str) – variable to plot on y axis

  • t (float, np.ndarray) – time(s) at which to plot (Default value = None)

  • z (float, np.ndarray) – stationary location(s) at which to plot (Default value = None)

  • x (float, np.ndarray) – moving location(s) at which to plot (Default value = None)

plot_gradient(t)¶

plots the material cross section to give a visual hint of where the material has pyrolyzed

Parameters

t (float, np.ndarray) – time(s) at which to plot

checkIfFileExists()¶

checks if output file already exists, else prompts user to specify a different file

output.plotBeta(layers, rhonu, rhomap, t)¶

plots extent of reaction (only to be used while running Hot-STARSHIP, for post-processing use SolutionReader and its plot capability)
